comments.body:
Is it really that precious about the hdf5 version? Could it just as well be `1.8.15*` or even `1.8*`?
Are you certain there aren't other binary dependencies which we should be pinning too? e.g. zlib

It could be `1.8.15*` but I don't think that will matter as I don't believe there will be another `1.8.15.x`.

> e.g. zlib

That comes from `hdf5` so I don't think we should over-specify it here. Or am I thinking about it wrong?
I just copied what GDAL has at the moment. Speaking of which - can we remove this pin now? Or are there some packages that aren't working with the latest hdf5?

We cannot remove the `hdf5` pin. We need `hdf5 1.8.15*` instead of `1.8.16*` to be compatible with the `default` channel `libnetcdf`. We will be able to upgrade only when we have our own `libnetcdf` compiled against `hdf5 1.8.16` and we are sure users won't be mixing default channel packages with conda-forge packages. (The latter we can never really know, but we can provide the majority of the packages compiled against our `hdf5`).

PS: What @pelson meant is to pin to `1.8.15*` instead of the exact version of `1.8.15.1` to avoid the maintenance burden in case new versions on the `1.8.15.x` series pop up.

Thanks for clarification  :smiley:
What is the problem with netcdf? Does it not support the latest hdf5?

> What is the problem with netcdf? Does it not support the latest hdf5?

It does but it needs to be compiled against it and we cannot mix hdf5 versions. As soon as we merge https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/378 and https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/213 we re-built everything against `hdf5 1.8.16`.
